name: Hotel Nevada

reviews.text: I'm not going to write an extensive review of this place like I've done with my other trips... I stayed here for one night on a business trip.
reviews.title: Very Average and SMOKEY!

likes.liked: — Great memorabilia; Good location; Decent pricing
likes.disliked: — Too smokey, even employees smoke; Old Furnishings; Not enough parking;

reviews.text: My first reaction was this place is SMOKEY! Even the employees behind the counter at the front desk smoke! Totally gross and nasty and I come from Vegas, which is the smoking capitol of the universe. Just plain unprofessional and too laid back for me.
reviews.title: Love Love It!
The PERFECT Hotel / Casino
reviews.text: My reservation # given was "Room 502" and I told the lady at the front desk this and she said OK and then proceeded to give me another room... I didn't argue -- I just thought it was their system... Plus, I had just driven 4 hours from Vegas in a low-power'd rental car (totally different story LOL) and was super-tired!

I got the room and it was kind of how I expected -- older and haggard... looks like it hadn't been updated in years -- except for the flat-screen TV on the wall (with all the wires hanging down)... The bad was a queen, but had a footboard which was not cool as I'm 6'1" and barely fit on the bed... The bathroom was SUPER-SMALL and had to have been made for a little person, as the shower looked like it wouldn't reach my shoulders!
reviews.title: best place to stay....

reviews.text: PLUS -- my room faced Aultman Street and the gross curtains wouldn't close all the way with the ancient air-conditioning unit, so I knew I was going to be in for trouble with the lights outside!!!
reviews.title: Fun place
Worst dinner our party of 4 has ever had....
reviews.text: Problem is their menu has all these beautiful pictures of food and what you get is a major disappointment...Ribs had no meat...rueben sandwich had no meat to speak of and Cobb salad was more like a regular salad...Everything was over priced and finally we should have just walked out because it took 45 minutes to get our food....Our mistake...

One of our party eats vegetarian and had been here before. She liked the Mediteranian wrap she had gotten another night. She and another party member got the Pasta Primavera this time and asked that the chicken be left off. The noodles were over cooked. The vegetables were frozen, not fresh. The sauce was OK at best.
reviews.title: Small town casino restaurant. Not impressed

reviews.text: I had the Prime Rib as did my son. It was good. The gravy on the mashed potatoes seemed like it came out of a can. The French Onion soup was OK.
reviews.title: Really good casino coffee shop at good prices
Delish.
reviews.text: Service was reasonably attentive but not particularly friendly. Prices were average for this town.

We visited twice, once for breakfast and once for dinner. Both were very good, and breakfast especially was an outstanding value. Pizza for dinner was also good. Servers were very good at refilling water and soda. Lots of racing memorabilia on display if that kind of thing interest you.
reviews.title: Good enough.....

reviews.text: First off, you cannot beat the price, and I would probably stay here again (purely for the adventure) if I ever needed to stay the night in Ely again for some reason. The hotel will innundate you with framed newpaper clippings, awards, articles - reminding you of what a historic place this is - hoping that it will detract you from what your eyes are actually seeing. The restaurant food is greasy (but tasty) and the portions are large and the prices are good. The rooms are small, but the beds were okay. I can stay in a Ramada or a La Quinta anywhere I go. However, the Hotel Nevada is definately "one of a kind."
reviews.title: Historic, Rustic, and somewhat depressing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fun, inexpensive, throwback hotel!!. Love the suites if we can get one, but very cozy, like staying at grandmas, love all the historic photos and such,cafe is good, only had breakfast there, we choose the Jailgose across the street for dinner. We have stayed here 3 times, the only, down side, can be the front desk staff,not as nice/friendly as the Jailhous motel across the street.
reviews.title: Always a fun place

reviews.text: We stay at the Jailhouse also, cause the staff is so kind,but a fun atmosphere is at the Hotel nevada..
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was fine - certainly nothing fancy but it seemed clean. the beds were kinda mushy but i slept fine.
reviews.title: I'd return

reviews.text: not many places to choose from in Ely and I can't imagine this place was better or worse than any other.
reviews.title: Lots of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here on the way to Oregon for a family 4th of July get-together in Oregon. Traveling across Nevada on Highway 50 is an eye-opening, fascinating experience I reccomend to anyone.
reviews.title: Try the Pizza

likes.liked: — The value for the mone and the History.
likes.disliked: — The lobby/casino area was smokey, like nearly all Nevada casinos.

reviews.text: Take this hotel for what it is, a glimpse into Nevada's colorful history. Sure It's not 4 or 5 Diamond service, but the price of the rooms should have told you that. There is so much character to this place we absolutely loved it. Yeah the lobby is smoky, but our "John Schnieder" (of Dukes of Hazzard "Fame") suite was spotless and fun without being to kitchsy. The staff and concierge were great, helping us get tickets to ride the Ely Ghost Train (another must) at the last minute. Lastly the food was wonderful! Try the pizza, it was AMAZING!
reviews.title: Good for grown-ups

likes.liked: — The room - clean, interesting, not at all 'cookie cutter', very unique.
likes.disliked: — No clear fire egress from room, smokey getting to the elevator and checking in.

reviews.text: Stay at the Hotel Nevada and spend a few days exploring Ely and the surrounding area's coloful history, and try to imagine what it was like in it's heyday. We had a wonderful time and are staying again in March of 2009 on our way to a Northern California vacation. We'll try and update after our return.
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice place to stay

reviews.text: Overall it was a great place to stay and the goods outnumbered the bads...except for one thing.
reviews.title: Piece of the Past

likes.disliked: — Tiny bathroom in our room (kids' was fine)

reviews.text: It's an old hotel and, for that reason, very cool!...also for that reason, very flammable. Fire escapes were not obvious, nor were routes or plans of how to get out if there was a fire. I stayed on the forth floor in a great room, but I always check out how to get out of room - particularly in old, flammable buildings when I'm on an upstairs floor, and it wasn't clear how I'd get out.
reviews.title: Interesting historic property
Solid Late Night Eats
reviews.text: Something about a solid breakfast at 1 am after a beverage or two. Nothing spectacular, but it definitely hit the spot.

reviews.title: A lot of food for your money
reviews.text: Decided on breakfast here before we continued our trip to Vegas. Wife ordered Eggs Benedict and I ordered Chicken Fried Steak. Food took a little longer than average to arrive, but it was worth the wait. Both plates were loaded with food, more than either of us could finish. Both were very good flavor-wise and cooked properly. Bring your appitite!
We got in late - something like 8:30pm - for dinner. Being off a casino, the approach to the restaurant is abundantly smoky - breathers beware!
reviews.title: Love the food!

reviews.text: Service was friendly though a bit slow. I ordered Spaghetti with Meatballs and Marinara. I wasn't expecting haute cuisine in rural Nevada, but the dish was wonderful! It certainly hit the spot. Portions are huge! The only downside was the table full of high school kids next to us that were loud, obnoxious and were running roughshod over the privacy of other patrons. They were even throwing food around and using long strings of obscene language at a high volume. Management made no effort whatsoever to remind these unruly punks of their unacceptable behavior. It didn't ruin dinner, but it left me with a bad impression of Ely's youth.
reviews.title: Charming little restaurant

reviews.text: We had dinner here and the food was pretty good, although I can't recall what I ate! The service was very good as well.
reviews.title: Very helpful and good food
Smoke City
reviews.text: Food was great and decor and atmoshere most interesting. I'd rate that excellent. The big problem is smoke. Nobody can smoke in the restaurant but they sure can in the casino and the casino opens directly into the restaurant. Plus you have to walk through the casino to get to and get out of the restaurant.

reviews.title: Decent fare in the middle of nowhere
reviews.text: The cafe in the Hotel Nevada is not new or fancy, but the burgers are good and they offer a nice menu for children/seniors. if you are hungry when you get to Ely, this is a reasonably priced option.

reviews.title: Most Fun Place to Stay in Ely
reviews.text: We always stay here when we are visiting or passing through Ely. The rooms are well maintained for their age but the showers are a real gamble. You never know if you're going to get a jackpot or be a loser. The staff is friendly and the food in the restraunt is good at a reasonable price.

reviews.title: Cafe inside the hotel
reviews.text: Great service from an older staff who really know what they're doing! Good basic food. The roast beef with gravy on bread was fab! Breakfast was very good and only $11 for two.

reviews.title: house keeper of hell
reviews.text: the head house keeper was treating her employees like they were salves an getting away with it when i asked a family member who lives in that town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times. Treated ourselves to the Kennecott Suite on this last visit. Loved it! Two bedrooms, living room & a jacuzzi room.
reviews.title: A favorite of mine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Nevada is my go-to hotel when I need a room in Ely - primarily because of the prices. It's the cheapest room in town. That said, the place is so fun and funky and full of history that, all things being equal, I'd stay here anyway.
reviews.title: I love this place!

reviews.text: The rooms are tiny and the furniture is oversized - it's more like a bed-and-breakfast room than a casino room. The shower is an adventure in and of itself, and those who like to luxuriate under the water will be in for a rude awakening - the temperature swings radically and suddenly from scalding to freezing, with no warning. Fortunately, there's a funny sign on the door that'll warn you about the plumbing's idiosyncrasies. Take it seriously.
reviews.title: Great historic hotel

reviews.text: Ask for a room on one of the upper floors, and you'll have a quieter stay.
reviews.title: Come for the history, but don't stay if you actually want to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Nevada is charming and historic, with a good restaurant and fun little casino. It's a good value with enough character to make you wonder why you'd EVER stay at a Motel 6. What a kick!
reviews.title: Best deal in Ely

reviews.text: We always love the Hotel Nevada. But, this time we thought the restaurant had a drop in quality. (Maybe a new chef?). Started with the new menu - a glossy, full color, several page affair - seemingly more suited to a Village Inn or Denny's - not the historic and iconic Hotel Nevada. I'd suggest they get rid of this menu and get one that is more in keeping with the "retro" feel of this hotel & restaurant.
reviews.title: Not as good as it used to be
Clean, comfortable, good value
reviews.text: I ordered the Reuben sandwich. Not good. Corned beef was sliced way too thick and not enough sauerkraut - plus a triple decker with 3 slices of bread. Just didn't work and definitely not what you expect in a Reuben. My husband had a taco salad. He didn't finish it - just not tasty. Breakfast was also a dispointment. I've always liked the steak and eggs - a tasty and inexpensive tradition. To me, it was the perfect anytime - breakfast, dinner or late night - meal. Now, price has gone up significantly and not as good as before.

reviews.title: The Smoke in the Kitchen
reviews.text: The one thing that hasn't changed - the rather poor service. Expect to wait awhile between ordering and being served. Not quite sure why it takes so long, it just does. The people watching is always interesting, so never been overly concerned about the wait.
The one meal item I did like was the Sicilian pizza - ordered that to-go for dinner one night and it was quite good.
reviews.title: The Best Chicken Fried Steak in Nevada
Okay food for late at night
reviews.text: This 1929 landmark was more than we had expected. The room was on the small side, but very clean and comfortable. The staff was great, and the hotel is well-located in the middle of downtown Ely.

description: The structure was one of the tallest in the state at one time.
